description.narrative: HIV/AIDS implications on the Mozambican communities are dire. For example, it has led to a reduction of life expectancy at birth and consequently to the reduction of the HDI. At present, 15% of pregnant women between 15-49 years are HIV positive. Demograph ic impact of AIDS for 2008 estimate that in 2009, nearly 1.6 million people were living with HIV/AIDS. These included 55.5% women + 9.2% children younger than 15 years. The project aims at supporting communities to reduce risk and vulnerability to HIV infe ction and to alleviate the impact of the epidemic on the affected households with a strong focus on women, through development of the economic capacities of the most vulnerable households and promotion of human rights, particularly the rights of PLWHAs (Pe ople Living with HIV/AIDS) and OVCs (Orphaned and Vulnerable Children) in the urban districts of Kamatova and Kamaxaquene. These are high density suburbs located in the outskirts of Maputo City in Mozambique. The area has high poverty rates and prone to pa ndemic diseases such as cholera, malaria and HIV/AIDS. In addition, the area is one of the central when it comes to domestic violence and other human rights violations, prostitution, and sexual abuse against women and young girls due to poverty.Objectives: 1. Improved food security2. Improved knowledge on pandemics at household level3. Strengthened capacities of Community Based Organisations4. Increased access of communities to Credit 5. Increased capacity of staff in implementing the project Activities: a. Promoting home gardeningb. Promoting income generationc. Facilitating and supporting savings and credit schemesd. Promoting access to education for vulnerable childrene. Promoting vocational training for vulnerable youth f. Supporting community based gr oups and organisationsg. Raising awareness on harmfulness of domestic violenceh. Home-based care to HIV-patients and psycho-social support to HIV-affected familiesThe main right-holders /beneficiaries of the project are 1500 vulnerable households from the urban districts of Kamavota and Kamaxaquene in Maputo City. These are vulnerable households from mainly women headed households, OVCs, Elderly and handicapped people. The project aims to reach at least 60% women beneficiaries. The project reaches also Dev elopment Committee Members in each of the 6 villages, Peer Educators, members of HIV Associations and activists from the selected areas, and locals school students.Implementing partner: The Ecumen
